title: How to Change Your Facebook Account's Password: 2 Ways

steps.title: Tap ☰ in the Facebook app.
steps.content: Tap ☰ in the Facebook app. This three-line menu icon is in the lower-right on iPhone or upper-right on Android. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings & Privacy > Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings & Privacy > Settings . If you're on an iPhone, you can tap the gear icon in the upper-right corner if you prefer. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the Meta Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap the Meta Accounts Center. This option is a large box at the top of your Settings & privacy menu. If you don't have the Meta Accounts Center, tap Password and security > Change password on the Settings page.

steps.title: Tap Password and Security.
steps.content: Tap Password and Security . It's under the "Account settings" header near the top of the menu. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Change password.
steps.content: Tap Change password . It's under the "Login & recovery" header near the top of the screen. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the profile you want to change the password for.
steps.content: Tap the profile you want to change the password for. If you have a Facebook and an Instagram profile (or multiple Facebook accounts), you'll see all those accounts listed here.

steps.title: Enter your current password in the top field.
steps.content: Enter your current password in the top field. If you don't remember your password, you can reset it or log in with a code if you tap Forgot Password? .

steps.title: Type a new password in the following field.
steps.content: Type a new password in the following field. There are a few steps you can take to make sure your password is secure , like using around 12 characters and incorporating a mix of numbers, letters, and special characters. Confirm the new password by re-typing it in the bottom field.

steps.title: Tap Change Password.
steps.content: Tap Change Password . Your Facebook password will be changed immediately.

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. It's in the upper-right corner of the window and has a small icon of a down arrow next to it.

steps.title: Click Settings & privacy > Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings & privacy > Settings . These options are next to a gear icon. Once you click Settings & privacy , the menu will change so you can click Settings . [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Meta Accounts Center.
steps.content: Click the Meta Accounts Center. This option is a large box at the top of your Settings & privacy menu. If you don't have the Meta Accounts Center, click Password and security > Change password on the Settings page.

steps.title: Click Password and Security.
steps.content: Click Password and Security . It's under the "Account settings" header near the top of the menu. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Change password.
steps.content: Click Change password . It's under the "Login & recovery" header near the top of the screen. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Click the profile you want to change the password for.
steps.content: Click the profile you want to change the password for. If you have a Facebook and an Instagram profile (or multiple Facebook accounts), you'll see all those accounts listed here.

steps.title: Enter your current password in the top field.
steps.content: Enter your current password in the top field. If you don't remember your password, you can reset it or log in with a code if you click Forgot Password? .

steps.title: Type a new password in the following field.
steps.content: Type a new password in the following field. There are a few steps you can take to make sure your password is secure , like using around 12 characters and incorporating a mix of numbers, letters, and special characters. Confirm the new password by re-typing it in the bottom field.

steps.title: Click Change Password.
steps.content: Click Change Password . Your Facebook password will be changed immediately.

steps.title: Click or tap Forgot password?.
steps.content: Click or tap Forgot password? . This button is under the Log in button. On desktop, the button text is blue, and on mobile, the button text is gray.

steps.title: Enter your cell phone number or email address.
steps.content: Enter your cell phone number or email address. If your phone number or email isn't associated with your Facebook account, you won't be able to use that to find your account. On desktop, you can type either the email or number into the field. On mobile, you can enter a number by default. Tap Search by email instead to enter your email address.

steps.title: Choose whether or not you want a login code.
steps.content: Choose whether or not you want a login code. Once Facebook has found your account, it will bring you to a page showing you the name on the account and the account's icon. If it's correct, click Continue to get a login code or Try another way to try something else. The steps will continue as if you are getting a login code. If you want to try another way, jump to the last step in this section.

steps.title: Enter the security code from your email.
steps.content: Enter the security code from your email. Click Continue to move to the next step.

steps.title: Enter a new password.
steps.content: Enter a new password. You must create a password that's at least six characters long, and Facebook recommends using a combination of letters, numbers, and punctuation marks to make a strong password. Click Continue to finish the process and log into Facebook. If you're struggling to think of a strong password that you can remember, check out this wikiHow article . If you don't have access to that email, click Try another way after Facebook has found your account. You can then choose Use my Google account to try and recover your account that way. If you don't remember your password and you don't have an email or phone number connected to your account, you won't be able to get your account back unless you can remember your original password.
